channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Federal investigation finds Harvard violated civil rights law
item.description: The Trump administration has issued a notice of violation accusing Harvard University of "deliberate indifference" toward Jewish and Israeli students.

item.title: Canada ditches digital tax after tariff threat from Trump
item.description: Canada scrapped a digital services tax that would have hit U.S. tech companies such as Google and Amazon after President Trump halted trade talks and ...

item.title: Suspect Identified in Deadly Ambush of Idaho Firefighters
item.description: The authorities said they believed the man they found dead on Canfield Mountain had set a brush fire and then shot at firefighters who responded, kill...

item.title: The WNBA is expanding again, adding 3 new cities for a record 18 teams
item.description: The WNBA is adding three new teams: Cleveland will join in 2028, Detroit begins play in 2029 and Philadelphia will be added to the roster in 2030. Thi...

item.title: Bob Vylan’s Chant Against Israel’s Military at Glastonbury Draws Criminal Inquiry
item.description: The band Bob Vylan led a chant of “Death, death to the I.D.F.” at Britain’s biggest music festival. A senior State Department official said the band’s...

item.title: Trump DHS links data for new citizenship tracking tool. And, Senate discusses tax bill
item.description: The Trump administration is developing a searchable national citizenship data system, worrying some officials. And, the Senate focuses on the sweeping...

item.title: Fordo Nuclear Site Work Taking Place in Iran, Satellate Images Show
item.description: Amid competing assessments of how badly the enrichment facility was damaged in U.S. strikes, Iran appears to be making its own inspection.

item.title: NYC Legal Aid Society Lawyers Threaten to Strike for Higher Pay
item.description: The lawyers who represent the city’s poorest defendants want to be paid on par with their federal counterparts. They last walked out in 1994.

item.title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Jury Tells the Judge One Juror Has an Issue as Deliberations Snag
item.description: An hour after the jury began its work deciding the sex-trafficking case, the foreperson told the court that one juror was having trouble following the...

item.title: Click, speak, move: These brain implants are poised to help people with disabilities
item.description: People who can no longer move or speak may soon have a new option: an implanted device that links their brain to a computer.

item.title: Nonprofits Lose Legal Bid to Halt U.K. Exports of Fighter Jet Parts to Israel
item.description: A top court ruled Monday that the British government, rather than judges, should decide on the “acutely sensitive and political issue.”

item.title: Violence Erupts Between Israeli Settlers and Military in West Bank
item.description: Hard-right activists clashed with troops and set fire to a security site following a growing wave of attacks on Palestinians in the occupied territory...

item.title: Fordo Nuclear Site Work Taking Place in Iran, Satellate Images Show
item.description: Amid competing assessments of how badly the enrichment facility was damaged in U.S. strikes, Iran appears to be making its own inspection.

item.title: The Prada Sandal That Led to Cries of Cultural Theft in India
item.description: An uproar over a shoe that resembles leather footwear worn by many Indians shows a growing sense that the country should be recognized for its product...

item.title: Thousands in Norway Mistakenly Told of Lottery Winnings
item.description: A state-owned gambling company apologized after telling players that they had won “erroneously high prizes.” It blamed the error on a faulty currency ...
